title: US Says At Least 3,000 North Korea Troops Training In Russia
content: At least 3,000 North Korean soldiers have been sent to Russia and are training there, the United States said Wednesday, warning that they would become legitimate targets for Kyiv if they engage in combat in Ukraine.
summary: At least 3,000 North Korean soldiers have been sent to Russia and are training there, the United States said Wednesday, warning that they would become legitimate targets for Kyiv if they engage in combat in Ukraine.

title: PM Modi Arrives In Delhi After Attending BRICS Summit In Russia
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi returned to Delhi after his two-day visit to Russia, during which he participated in the 16th BRICS Summit in Kazan.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi returned to Delhi after his two-day visit to Russia, during which he participated in the 16th BRICS Summit in Kazan.

title: Video Explainer: Understanding The LAC And The Stand-Off With China
content: PM Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping held their first "formal bilateral meeting" since the military stand-off between India and China began in 2020. Here is an explainer with video, a map, and satellite images to help understand the LAC.
summary: PM Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping held their first "formal bilateral meeting" since the military stand-off between India and China began in 2020. Here is an explainer with video, a map, and satellite images to help understand the LAC.

title: UK's Birmingham Airport Evacuated Over "Suspicious Vehicle"
content: A major international airport serving the UK's second-largest city was evacuated and all flights were suspended for several hours on Wednesday because of a security alert.
summary: A major international airport serving the UK's second-largest city was evacuated and all flights were suspended for several hours on Wednesday because of a security alert.

title: American Man Declared Brain Dead Awakens Just Before Organ Removal
content: Concerns about organ donation procedures arose after a Kentucky man appeared to wake up moments before his organs were to be removed.
summary: Concerns about organ donation procedures arose after a Kentucky man appeared to wake up moments before his organs were to be removed.

title: "BRICS Is For The Fairies Until China, India Get Serious," Says Mr 'BRICS'
content: The idea of the BRICS group ever challenging the US dollar is for the fairies as long as China and India remain so divided and refuse to cooperate on trade, the former Goldman Sachs economist who came up with the BRIC acronym told Reuters.
summary: The idea of the BRICS group ever challenging the US dollar is for the fairies as long as China and India remain so divided and refuse to cooperate on trade, the former Goldman Sachs economist who came up with the BRIC acronym told Reuters.

title: 3 Dead Over Suspected Carbon Monoxide Poisoning At Elderly Care Home In UK
content: Three people were found dead and four others were taken to hospital after a suspected carbon monoxide poisoning at a care home for the elderly in southwest England, police said on Wednesday.
summary: Three people were found dead and four others were taken to hospital after a suspected carbon monoxide poisoning at a care home for the elderly in southwest England, police said on Wednesday.

title: Israel Strikes Lebanon's UNESCO World Heritage Site City 'Tyre'
content: Israeli strikes on Wednesday pounded Lebanon's Tyre, an ancient coastal city which boasts a UNESCO World Heritage site, leaving swathes of its centre in ruins.
summary: Israeli strikes on Wednesday pounded Lebanon's Tyre, an ancient coastal city which boasts a UNESCO World Heritage site, leaving swathes of its centre in ruins.

title: War With Israel Likely To Wipe 9% Off Lebanon's GDP: UN
content: The war between Israel and armed group Hezbollah is expected to wipe 9% off Lebanon's national wealth as measured by GDP, the United Nations said on Wednesday.
summary: The war between Israel and armed group Hezbollah is expected to wipe 9% off Lebanon's national wealth as measured by GDP, the United Nations said on Wednesday.

title: Iranian Hackers Looking At US Election Websites Ahead Of Polls: Microsoft
content: An Iranian hacking group is actively scouting US election-related websites and American media outlets as election day nears, according to a Microsoft blog published on Wednesday.
summary: An Iranian hacking group is actively scouting US election-related websites and American media outlets as election day nears, according to a Microsoft blog published on Wednesday.

title: Bangladesh Bans Student Wing Of Ex PM's Party Under Anti-Terror Law
content: Bangladesh banned the student wing of ousted premier Sheikh Hasina's party on Thursday, citing its involvement in violent attacks on demonstrations that toppled the autocratic leader.
summary: Bangladesh banned the student wing of ousted premier Sheikh Hasina's party on Thursday, citing its involvement in violent attacks on demonstrations that toppled the autocratic leader.

title: Hezbollah Confirms Nasrallah's Likely Successor Killed In Israeli Strike
content: Hezbollah confirmed Wednesday that Israel killed Hashem Safieddine, the apparent successor of its slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, in a strike, without saying when or where it happened.
summary: Hezbollah confirmed Wednesday that Israel killed Hashem Safieddine, the apparent successor of its slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, in a strike, without saying when or where it happened.

title: Norway's Crown Princess On "Sick Leave" Due To Rare Lung Condition
content: Norway's Crown Princess Mette-Marit has been placed on sick leave for at least a week due to a rare lung condition from which she suffers, the palace said Wednesday.
summary: Norway's Crown Princess Mette-Marit has been placed on sick leave for at least a week due to a rare lung condition from which she suffers, the palace said Wednesday.

title: Trudeau Meets Legislators Unhappy With His Leadership, They Want Him To Go
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Wednesday met legislators from his ruling Liberals, some of whom blame him for the party's poor showing in the polls and want him to quit after nine years in power.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Wednesday met legislators from his ruling Liberals, some of whom blame him for the party's poor showing in the polls and want him to quit after nine years in power.

title: Chinese-Controlled Bot Army Tries To Influence US Voters: Microsoft Report
content: An army of Chinese-controlled social media bots is attempting to influence voters in Alabama, Texas and Tennessee, while denigrating Florida Senator Marco Rubio, according to new research published on Wednesday by Microsoft.
summary: An army of Chinese-controlled social media bots is attempting to influence voters in Alabama, Texas and Tennessee, while denigrating Florida Senator Marco Rubio, according to new research published on Wednesday by Microsoft.

title: In A First, Scientists Discover Dinosaur Fossils In Hong Kong
content: Scientists have discovered dinosaur fossils in Hong Kong for the first time, the city's government announcement on Wednesday, adding that the species remains unknown.
summary: Scientists have discovered dinosaur fossils in Hong Kong for the first time, the city's government announcement on Wednesday, adding that the species remains unknown.

title: Female Athletes Lost Nearly 900 Medals To Transgender Rivals: UN Report
content: Over 600 female athletes across 29 sports have lost medals, sparking ongoing debates on gender inclusivity in sports.
summary: Over 600 female athletes across 29 sports have lost medals, sparking ongoing debates on gender inclusivity in sports.

title: Highlights: Terror Attack In Turkey's Ankara, Hostages Taken, Say Reports
content: Several people died and got injured in an explosion outside Turkish Aerospace Industries (TAI) near Turkey capital Ankara today.
summary: Several people died and got injured in an explosion outside Turkish Aerospace Industries (TAI) near Turkey capital Ankara today.

title: PM Modi, Xi Welcome "Complete Disengagement" Between Soldiers Along LAC
content: India and China on Wednesday welcomed the patrolling agreement announced this week that calls for "complete (military) disengagement" along the Line of Actual Control in the Himalayas.
summary: India and China on Wednesday welcomed the patrolling agreement announced this week that calls for "complete (military) disengagement" along the Line of Actual Control in the Himalayas.

title: 2 Terrorists And 4 Civilians Killed, 14 Injured In Turkey Terror Attack
content: Four people were killed and 14 others wounded in an attack on the headquarters of a top Turkish defence firm near Ankara, Turkish officials said Wednesday.
summary: Four people were killed and 14 others wounded in an attack on the headquarters of a top Turkish defence firm near Ankara, Turkish officials said Wednesday.
